intro: Leucoptera oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved whiteleaf plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement and white, velvety undersides, which give it its common name. Native to tropical regions of Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking unique foliage.
